thread.title: Police searching for sellers of fake Falcons tickets - Atlanta Journal Constitution
thread.title_full: Police searching for sellers of fake Falcons tickets - Atlanta Journal Constitution

title: Police searching for sellers of fake Falcons tickets - Atlanta Journal Constitution
text:
Police searching for sellers of fake Falcons tickets Police searching for sellers of fake Falcons tickets Crime View Caption Hide Caption Atlanta police are searching for three people in connection with recent sales of fake Falcons tickets. (Credit: Channel 2 Action News) Story Highlights Three people are being sought by police in connection with the sale of fake football tickets. Atlanta police say not only have scalpers been selling fake Falcons tickets to recent football games, they’ve also been giving counterfeit cash as change, Channel 2 Action News reports. Some spent as much as $1,100 for tickets to games such as the NFC championship game in Atlanta , the television station reported. Atlanta police spokesman Sgt. Warren Pickard said he’s personally worked undercover to combat unauthorized buying and selling of tickets. MORE: Officials tell fans how to spot fake Super Bowl tickets “For the last couple of games, it was overwhelming,” Pickard said. “We had people getting to the doors thinking they were getting in and being denied entry.” The police department is offering a $2,000 reward for information leading to arrests because they want to curb this kind of criminal activity before the Super Bowl comes to Atlanta in 2018. “We’re trying to get ahead of it,” Pickard told Channel 2. “We have a (public service announcement) coming out in the next couple of months.” 
Anyone with information is asked to contact Crime Stoppers Atlanta at 404-577-8477, text information to 274637 or visit crimestoppersatlanta.org. Tipsters can also remain anonymous and be eligible for rewards of up to $2,000. Related
